author: {'steamid': '76561198291914791', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 481, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 305, 'last_played': 1604731341}
review:
Завоевав определенную репутацию на благо Альгейры, тебя отправляет на очередное задание сама Амаранта Фелисидас. В этот раз всё еще хуже. Судя по полученной информации, Партизаны собрались брать столицу Альгейры. Недолго думая, собрав необходимую снарягу, ты отправляешься пешкодраликом в столицу, ибо с транспортом сейчас напряженка, поэтому выклянчать лишний грузовичок у квартирмейстера не получится. Ладно. Путь в столицу выдался относительно спокойно и по пришествию вроде понимаешь, что успел и надо тщательно подготовиться. Но черта с два. ФПС падает до нуля и на том же месте спавнится кучка Партизан. Ничего другого не придумав, ты пускаешься на утёк до самой больницы. Запопуття получив пару маслин, ты всё же успеваешь добежать до больницы. Снова фпс падает до нуля. Не дрейфь, это всего лишь где-то граната взорвалась. Самое верное решение, это заныкаться в туалете и сидеть ждать. F5 работает, значит пока всё в порядке. Неуспев подлечиться, к тебе залетает партизан, ты ему НА! с Кольта навскидку, улетел товарищ. F5. Снова фпс падает до нуля. Гранатами кидаются гады. Влетает еще один. ПУЦ! Готов. Фух... F5. Залетают двое! Ты одному пуц! Готов. Второй успевает зацепить. Экран побелел. ШОК. F9. Во время думаешь, что сделать, чтобы успеть. Ведь сейчас зайдут двое. Пуф-пуф! Оба готовы. Пронесло на этот раз. F5. 
Спустя полтора часа битва заканчивается, ты стерев пот со лба, кое-как выходишь из туалета, удачно обойдя гору трупов, рядом лежащую. Собираешь с них добро и отправляешься скорей обратно в Артриго. Нужно отчитаться о проделанной работе и получить свои денежки. Так и живем.

review: The ultimate source of gun porn available to you is here. The game is as mentioned, a squad tactical shooter blah blah blah it's jagged alliance but a little bit more indepth...Just a little. Alright maybe a mega fuck ton more depth involved and a UI that may be the reason why my game crashes every hour.. Seriously, this game will crash when least expected. I've never been more paranoid on losing all my progress in any game but this one so I just had to assign the right mouse button to auto save, just to be safe. ANYWAYS, it's one fun game once you get ahead of the mechanics and bugs. Hell, there is even a community mod that fixes most the bugs and lessens the amount of crashing (not in my case but hey the game may be in your favor) so get this game during a sale if you're living on change like me and you'll have more than your moneys worth of fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008381495', 'num_games_owned': 320, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 3121, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3089, 'last_played': 1513783768}
review:
此游戏有中文补丁
此游戏有汉化补丁
此游戏有汉化补丁


玩法类似铁血联盟，游戏是半回合制策略游戏（不用暂停等回合，但所有动作要计算时间），游戏内容：

主角是一个资深雇佣兵，收到一个国家政府的委托去一个东欧小国抓捕一个通缉犯，游玩过程中玩家可以招募其他雇佣兵（要定期付薪水）来协助你完成任务，这个东欧小国有两个势力一个是政府军，一个是游击队，你可以选择倾斜到哪一边，或者当双面间谍，游戏剧情自由度超级大。
游戏内枪械丰富，可以自由组装各种配件，比如圣诞树AR(滑稽
子弹种类也很多，比如AP弹药。HP弹药，种类齐全
还有相对齐够用的携行具，防弹衣及防弹插板系统（MOD会提供更丰富的内容，可惜没有汉化补丁，原版的汉化补丁似乎可以用在这个上面，按照汉化补丁作者所说：“多出来的任务内容依然是英文，剩下和原版一样的任务及菜单提示都是中文” ）

此游戏还有两个被官方抱上来的MOD：

 《蓝日》（英文名是The blue sun,画质更加精细游戏内容极大丰富，多了几个英文任务 ，在steam里勾选了参加测试什么什么bsm什么什么的就能直接使用了,安装MOD后如果需要请重新打汉化补丁,此MOD打汉化补丁会极大增加跳出几率，多存档)

《Hard Life》（已经被官方收编，买本体就送这个，内容比原版更加强大丰富，要单独下载，可惜没有汉化补丁）

汉化补丁

链接: https://pan.baidu.com/s/1c28bKtU 密码: qh3h

使用方法：
如果要玩HC原版的话，先下载HC(记得语言选择英文，默认是俄语...)，然后打上非官方补丁（修复下挂武器无法装弹的问题等）,然后打上汉化补丁
注：因为是不完美汉化补丁，所以容易引起游戏崩溃，记得养成随手存档的好习惯 ：）
此游戏盗版资源难找，安装麻烦，不如买这个，然后打汉化补丁，直接开玩。
 不来一份吗少年？

2021年更新，汉化补丁资源我也没了，铁资网关闭了，也没法再去下资源了，伤心...真心想玩的推荐用有道翻译截屏翻译...

author: {'steamid': '76561198002101271', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 15510, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8797, 'last_played': 1597566971}
review:
It's the gamer's lament: some of the best games ever made are busted, buggy, and obviously unfinished. Sadly, such is the case with this game. One of the best titles on Steam, despite languishing in almost complete obscurity, 7.62 High Caliber is a Russian-made real-time/pauseable squad tactics game with a stupid name and an absurd attention to detail that permeates nearly every aspect of its design.

Yes, I do mean *absurd.* Take the magazine out of a gun, and its in-game model will reflect this. You can fold the stock of your rifle, and this too will show up. Your character will even hold the weapon differently, closer to their body. Every attachment will appear on every single gun, which you can examine up close within a special window, even though this is a strategy game and you have no reason (though you do have the option) to zoom in ludicrously close enough to even notice that level of detail in the game. Equip a backpack? It shows up on your character. A carry vest? Yep, and with a few unique models. Armor? Yeah, that too, so long as it's not a concealable plate carrier carried underneath clothing, in which case you won't see it. Put on a belt with pouches and there you go, you'll see that too. And I haven't mentioned yet all the different uniforms you can wear, each with their own camoflauge value. It's like having a box of virtual GI Joes.

It's not strictly cosmetic, either. Every piece of gear has a purpose. Every choice a tangible effect on how a character performs in combat. Most importantly, these effects are all sensible, and you don't need a manual to understand them. Fold the stock on your rifle, and shooting from the hip becomes faster. You'll also require less room to point your gun around, which is a big deal in narrow hallways. Of course, lacking the stock means less accuracy and more recoil. Backpacks give you more room to carry stuff, but you can't maneuver while prone quite as well if you're wearing one. Thick armor with added trauma plates will protect you from damage, but it will slow you down unless you've got lots of muscle. Scopes will help you see farther away, but will limit your field of view whenever you use them. Night vision goggles wash the world in green, but help you see better in the dark. Flashlight attachments on your guns throw cones of light wherever you aim, and in later fights when everybody's kitted out on both sides, the evening haze is full of dozens of jumping, darting laser sights drawing grim lines between combatants.

On top of this, there's an insane ballistics simulation at work here that really does take this game above and beyond. Bullets are 3D-modelled, and hundreds of them may be flying through the air at any given time. There's surface penetration modeling, and bullets sometimes ricochet off hard materials like brick and concrete depending on angle and caliber. Bullets can split in half (!) with each half hitting separate targets. I once witnessed a stray shot badly missing its mark, only for the bullet to hit the ground, ricochet hard vertical, and hit another bad guy right under the chin. Grenades don't do magic damage, either. They shoot dozens upon dozens of fragments over their area of effect, mimicking their real-life behavior. It's really impressive to watch, and great for the gameplay as well. Go prone and pray as the shrapnel skates over your head in slow motion. Every near-miss is a thrill.

The attention to detail goes beyond gunplay. This game was doing character catalogues before The Witcher made it cool. Throughout your journey, you can learn conflicting accounts of various important figures, and these details are stored in your journal so you can form your own opinions on who most deserves a bullet to the dome. Your main task in the tiny, fictional nation of Algiera is to extract a high-profile con-artist, dead or alive, but you have to work with various local entities to accomplish that task. You can throw your lot in with the corrupt government, or choose to work with the idealistic, crazy rebels, or you can play both sides against the middle. Apparently, you can also do things for yourself, try to take the country for your very own. I can't imagine that would be easy. I haven't tried that yet.

Where things start to come apart is when you realize this game is an obvious beta. It really is. But now, in the age of perpetual Early Access periods, is that really a sin anymore? The game's got a memory leak issue that ensures crashes are inevitable, but the more RAM you have, the easier it'll be for you. It does seem to crash very gracefully, however. A gentle bump back to the desktop, and a double-click later you're back in the game in maybe ten seconds. Annoying, yes, but not such a big deal as long as you have multiple saves. Since you can save any time you want, it's minor.

The real issue is the controls. They're workable, but they take some getting used to. The camera is the biggest offender. It lets you go anywhere, and quickly, and the general feel of it should be familiar to anyone used to working with 3D modelling suites. Problem is, this is a GAME we're talking about here, not Maya or whatever. There's lots of depth and plenty of options, but thankfully not too many keys to work with. You can keep them clustered around WASD very comfortably. I use a Steam Controller, so that alone shows you that the controls aren't THAT bad. Though the *feel* of the game's interface leaves a lot to be desired.

Despite its age and obscurity, the game DOES actually look very, very good. A good, unified art style melds well with subdued graphical effects. Despite the primitive character models, the foliage is dense and the jungles look surprisingly pretty awesome. No, really. There's a TON of foliage in outdoor environments, and it looks surprisingly realistic. There's limited destructability in the game's environments, mostly limited to background objects. It's fun watching a guard tower explode into fragments when you hit it with an RPG, or unleashing a torrent of leaves when a grenade goes off in the brush, but you won't be leveling any buildings.

But when it comes to combat, 7.62 is second to none. The game's age is a non-issue. This game easily has the best real-time tactical combat I've ever enjoyed. There's no obvious "cheating" in the game's design. Everything is based on relatively-realistic background simulation. For example, in a modern game like Firaxis' XCOM 2, if you're spotted, the enemies instantly know where all of your people are. Not so here. The AI in this game only knows what it sees, or the last known location of what it has seen before but is now hidden. You can fool gullible enemies into underestimating your force strength and lure them into traps. Shock and surprise are simulated, so if your camoflagued team suddenly springs out of the bushes out of nowhere, your suddenly-cornered enemies are liable to go into shock and panic as you line up perfect shots. It's incredible. And the more disciplined your foe, the less likely your opponents are to be tricked into such ambushes. Elite soldiers are perfectly content with sitting in an advantageous position with their sights trained and waiting on where they expect you to be - which can also be countered with a high-stealth guy in a ghille suit you left behind to cover the flank.

The depth of this game's strategic approach is truly something else. The simple fact that the AI doesn't have god awareness allows you all sorts of surprise tactics. The enemy can surprise you, too. They're all too eager to come jumping around a corner, shooting you in the chest before darting quickly out of sight.

Keep in mind that everything your troops do is entirely due to your direction, however. Your people aren't automated at ALL, so you have to be aware of what's going on with everyone at all times. Thankfully, there's time deceleration and pause-anytime to help keep things manageable.

Highly recommended.

author: {'steamid': '76561198140377584', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 315, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 315, 'last_played': 1497120960}

author: {'steamid': '76561198168968716', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 270, 'playtime_forever': 5728, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3992, 'last_played': 1699534330}
review:
百万ドルの賞金首I.Bashirovを追って内戦の火種燻る南米Algeiraへ傭兵が飛び込む冒険活劇。
あなたは必要な情報を得るために政府軍か、反政府ゲリラのどちらかに加担することを求められるでしょう。目的達成のために自らも傭兵を雇い、部隊を指揮してください。呆れるほど細かいマイクロ・マネジメントと、0.1秒単位の行動管理が生死を分ける戦場があなたを待っています。
ダイアログはきちんと読みましょう。とりあえず銃を撃ってから物を考えるスタイルでは、おそらくこの戦争を潜り抜けることはできません。重要な情報が、後からログを確認できない会話文の中にのみ仕込まれている場合が多々あります。話自体もけっこう面白いので、読み飛ばすのは損ですよ。

戦闘に勝てないとお嘆きのアナタ、それは戦い方が間違っているか、たんに喧嘩を売る相手を間違えているのです。
本作は独特な戦い方を求められます、いままで数多の戦場（ゲーム）で身につけた技術が足枷になっているかもしれません。まずは銃を撃つときに一々狙いをつけるのをやめましょう。頭を狙う癖も直しましょう。リアル系だからといって、とりあえず伏せるのはやめてください。
本作に登場する敵は、死なない限り全力で戦い続けるエイリアンではありません。被弾すれば怯みます、銃弾が近くを掠めれば動揺します。深刻なダメージを負えば身動きが取れなくなります。そう、本作に登場するのは歴とした人間なのです。
常に相手との距離と数を考えながら戦いましょう。相手より先に撃つことを意識し、機敏に動き回って翻弄するのです。一箇所に留まって銃を撃ち続けるのは得策ではありません。

本作は銃のサイズがでかいほど発砲にかかる時間が長く設定されています。「この距離なら拳銃のほうが早い、ナイフのほうが早い」を再現しているのです。アサルトライフルは万能じゃないんです！常にバックアップ用の武器の携帯を忘れずに！
敵の装備をよく見るのです！至近距離で接敵した、相手の武器は？拳銃？どの位置に構えていますか？腰だめ？それはいけない！相手はすぐに発砲してきます！すぐに銃の狙いをつけるのを止めて全力で走るべきです、物陰へ、いますぐ！
もし相手が長いライフルを構えていたら？まだ射撃姿勢すら整っていなかったら？そのときは、さあ、あなたのナイフの出番です！

いまならゲーム内容を大幅拡張＆高難易度化するBlue Sun Mod、それをベースに本体をカスタマイズしたスタンドアローン版Hard Lifeまでついてきちゃう。
本作はメモリリークを引き起こすようで、長時間プレイしていると次第にゲームが重くなり、強制終了します。こまめなセーブを忘れずに。

author: {'steamid': '76561198004543749', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 1001, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 456, 'last_played': 1709145870}

review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198068749253', 'num_games_owned': 407, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 1030, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1030, 'last_played': 1462620955}
review:
[b]Overall Score: 9.0/10 [/b]

7.62 is an RPG, real-time tactical squad game in the likes of Jagged Alliance Series , Silent-Storm and X-Com. A must have for hardcore fans of these types of series. It's a hidden gem, taking the squad based level combat to a entirely new stage of complexity. 

[b]Impression:[/b]
The storyline is actually great - you are a mercenery from a previous series: Brigade E5: New Jagged Union (another gem IMO). You have a mix of characters and backgrounds, some of which you will find very convincing - and bring additional immersion into the game. Your quest is to find a "businessman" who went into hiding in a latin-like country of Algeira. You will need to be resourceful; you will need to navigate your hero(heroine) character , finding good companions and simply fighting to survive. You will need to be well-planned for the dangers ahead, in a volatile world full of bandits, military personnel and organized crime.
 
Combat is a heaven for those who thrive with micro-management. The combat progresses real-time, having to manage each and every person's actions in the squad, more or less at the same time (can be paused). Small movements like simply raising a weapon,as well as firing, has its own measure of time. It changes the tactical nature of combat totally by having to trade-off speed for power - imagine that in a closed confined quarter - it's actually better to use the fast-response type weak pistols rather than slow firing powerful rifles. The same thing cannot be said for large open spaces. 

Combat is fast moving and generally unforgiving if you face high-level enemies - or make a stupid tactical decision (like throwing a grenade too close to you), or simply get unlucky (like meeting a great number of enemies in open space at daytime as opposed to night). Saving and loading are frequent - if you want all of your squadmates to come out of combat alive.

The health system is equally complex as the combat time-mechanics. If your squadmate gets hit in the head, chances are that you will be dead (if you raise the difficulty level), or you will get blinded - which renders the screen in a white-red curtain that renders the person totally useless. Critical damage to limbs and body can happen - which simply cannot be fixed by simple medi-kits; you need to go to a doctor.

The inventory system is equally complex and shines, for those who are meticulous at sorting and storing things. It requires you to think about how to carry a wide assortment of not only weapons, but bullet magazines in pockets, on shoulders, around the neck, belts and different type of bags.

This a gun-porn game. There are simply so many types of handguns, rifles, grenades and body armor. You can end up being very confused about the best outfit. In fact, I believe the character actually needs to use the weapon for a while, to get proficient (can't remember if this was a vanilla or a mod feature). There are mods which improve the vanilla by a lot (BSM mod and Hard-Life, both available on Steam)

[b]Likes[/b]
[list]
 [*]Storyline is good an immersive, at times comical
 [*] Combat and inventory system (great if you like challanges)
 [*] A large list of weapons and items
[/list]

[b]Dislikes[/b]
[list]
 [*] Quirky and glitchy
 [*] Difficulty spikes are at times unforgiving
[/list]

author: {'steamid': '76561197970995503', 'num_games_owned': 942, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 1603, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1543, 'last_played': 1425128068}
review:
The graphics, at least the textures suck, and sucked when the game came out. The missions are barely understandable but most are just the same 'go here, do this and come back'. The trick is to figure out what and where. You can tweak and adjust your viewpoint so you'll see the world. You'll be able to plan several seconds ahead of the incoming engagement. You will find out how little you know about squad tactics and if you want to learn from your mistakes you will try again, and again, and again, ad nauseam. Then there's the guns, and the more guns and the attachements you can hook them up with.... that is, if you live long enough. The game is hard, not for beginners and COD enthusiasts.

The same goes for E5 the next brigade union.

Mixed review? I love the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198023656416', 'num_games_owned': 1553, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 1270, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1270, 'last_played': 1488317968}
review:
7.62 High Calibre is a real-time tactical strategical action game released in 2007, similar to Xcom series while in the battling mode but in real time. You are a mercenary tasked to find a russian who stole from colleagues who hired you. There's some RPG elements inside.

You will need to find clues, upgrade yourself, hire other mercenaries, equip them, find your target. You know who he is, you don't know what he has. You'll find him, and when you do, you'll know what he has and you need to make it out in one piece while completing your task.

The storyline is nice, but the replies from the NPCs are kinda repetitive. The music is nice, the graphics are ok. There're quite some interesting choices you can make, the camera is a little hard to control. Pausing is crucial during engagements.

7.62 Hard Life is a fan made enhanced version based on 7.62 High Calibre, released in 2015, provided free and comes with the steam workshop, The workshop doesn't have much but there're a few good mods. It's harder to play compared to 7.62 High Calibre due to the sheer amount of enemies, but you'll be able to handle it if you've played the original first. Weapon pack mods are recommended to lessen the difficulty by a little and adds more diversity in weapons.

I would totally recommend it to Xcom lover, but you need to be more patient with these game compared to Xcom. It's already worth its current price, but do grab it when there's a sale, being thrifty is a virtue.

author: {'steamid': '76561198079704709', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 271, 'playtime_forever': 424, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 424, 'last_played': 1485129835}
review:
I am not a huge fan of Strategy/Simulator games, but I can see the highlights of 7,62 High Calibre which makes it a classic. Since the game was released on 2007, don’t expect it to be top notch with the graphics, effects or the audio like the games released today.

The features listed on the Store page remains true to its word and if there was one thing I liked most were the variety of guns and character’s to choose from. When you first start, you will be given the option to select your mercenary and use attribute/skill points to your preference on the list. Along with that are the fine detail on the player’s map, inventory mission and other settings.

With this, the game gives a thorough detail on your inventory, actions and missions to guide the player too. It’s not the best, but regardless, a great old-school game that I would recommend trying out.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067176866', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 152, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 121, 'last_played': 1486928561}
review: If realistic tactical shooters are your thing, then look no further. I've barely scratched the surface of this game, but before playing I watched hours of guides. This is the game for in depth inventory management, mercenary hiring, stat min/maxing, taking in to account ballistics, weapon degradation, weather conditions, armor, reload/fire speeds, movement speeds, positional accuracy and more explicit details when it comes to planning your perfect tactical fire fight. Highly strategic game with a large learning curve and massive complexity. In addition to all of that, it manages to be quite a bit of fun, and the dialogue and story aren't awful. It can even be humorous at times. I am playing using the blue sun mod, which can be conveniently added directly through the steam client.

author: {'steamid': '76561198248142244', 'num_games_owned': 464, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 190, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 133, 'last_played': 1562773658}
review:
Прекрасный представитель жанра тактических RPG-стратегий.
 Игра во многом принимает идею Jagged Alliance, но не смотря на отсутствие пошагового режима (заменённого на Pause-mod) на три головы обходит, схожую с этой игрой, JA:BiA.
 Плюсы:
+Обширные возможности игры
+Прекрасно реализованная система боя
+Довольно неплохая графика (для 2007г)
+Размеры локаций не уступающие JA2
+Достаточный орсенал оружия, брони и аксессуаров
+Локации нарисованы очень красиво и правдопадобно
+Затягивающий геймплей
Минусы:
-Самих локаций мало (по моему мнению)
-Локацие довольно пусты
-Довольно сложный интерфейс
-Плохая оптимизация
Итог:
 Прекрасная тактическая стратегия, стоящая рядом с Fallout и Jagged Alliance
8,5 из 10)

author: {'steamid': '76561197971261412', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 165, 'playtime_forever': 386, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 165, 'last_played': 1690837793}
review:
(note: i prefer the 'hard life' version of this game, despite the fact that iteration suffers from humorous translation problems. being able to customize how easy or hard 7.62 is a big plus for me in hard life)

This is easily the greatest X-COM/Jagged Alliance alike you've never played. I am going to tell you why, with a bit history on the side.

Long before Aperion was founded and way back in the 90s, Vladimir Ufnarovskiy finished his college degree and proceeded to make his first computer game - Remember Tomorrow (or Pomni Budushcheye), a 4X title with a few unique spins. Sadly, that game didn't really take off anywhere, superseded in popularity by games like Master of Orion and the Russian multi-genre, cult classic Parkan: Imperial Chronicles. A modern reimaging of Remember Tomorrow was released on Steam months ago: Polaris Sector. That game is absolutely worth checking out if you want to scratch your 4X itch.

Apeiron came to frution in 1999 under Ufnarovskiy's direction, and in 2002, a free to play prototype of their first game E5 was released. It gained a lot of positive attention, and 1C offered support and funds to help turn it into a full retail title. The proof of concept version of E5 had the foundations of all of Aperion's games: intricate control of squadmates and insanely detailed bullet ballistics. It was a mild success in its native country, but hardly made a dent outside of it. Regardless, E5 has earned a place in the hearts of those who wanted to see what 7.62's precursor is like and stuck with it until the end. 

7.62 was released as a direct sequel to E5 in late 2007, and improved upon its flaws in various ways. I'm not going to beat around the bush - the UI in E5 is horrid, but 7.62 improved interaction with the game and made it more easy to swallow for newcomers. 7.62 is Aperion's most well known title, and for a lot of good reasons. Have you ever wanted to take upon the role of an mercenary operator in the middle of some sweaty and hot fictional South American country undergoing a civil war? This is what makes 7.62 great, even if it does suffer from bugs. You can obsess over every little piece of equipment you can carry and see how it can serve you best. Combat feels confusing, weighty and incredibly satisfying all at once. Not a whole lot compares after seeing a hostile flop over dead when you shoot him with your hunting shotgun, or tagging mulitple hostiles at once with said weapon. Just about all of the missions in 7.62 in are 'go there and do this', but it's impossible to predict if you'll get there safely because of how frantic the combat is.

Sadly, there is a fly in the ointment for just about all of Aperion's games: the meele combat feels like an afterthought, but that's something to expected for an game engine that puts so much thought into how firearms affect everything. Along with this, all of their games are very ambitious and are riddled with bugs from development oversights. Still, if you have the patience and don't mind some bumps on the ride, you owe it to yourself to check out 7.62. A small, but incredibly dedicated community has worked to iron out the most offensive bugs, so make sure you take the time to see what fixes are out there.

Another thing to note is that Apeiron provided development and historical counselling when Battlefront was making Combat Mission: Afganistan. There's an extra little tidbit for you if you like the Combat Mission games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006563527', 'num_games_owned': 3471, 'num_reviews': 909, 'playtime_forever': 630, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 147, 'last_played': 1481686072}
review:
Ein Taktik-RPG das sich offensichtlich an Klassiker wie Jagged Alliance etc. anlehnt. Das die Grafik mittlerweile altbacken ist, geschenkt. So lange das Gameplay taugt und da ist ein wenig der Hund begraben. Das Game braucht etwas bis man damit warm wird, dass liegt unter anderem an der hakeligen Steuerung, der unübersichtlichen Kamera/Kartengestaltung und dem unpraktischen/nicht intuitiven Interface. Dazu kommen noch kleinere Bugs (ich musste zB einen Speicherstand laden weil die Waffe "verloren" ging bei der Reise von der einen Stadt zum ersten Gefecht). Die Gefechte wiederrum sind irgendwie schwierig weil man keinen direkten Einfluss auf den Charakter dabei hat, man klickt auf welchen Gegner er schießen soll und irgendwann, gefühlt nach 2 Wochen und 3 schon geschluckten Treffer schießt er auch mal. Da könnte man direkt die Tischplatte durchbeißen. Das Spiel ist im Gefecht auch nicht automatisch im rundenbasierten Modus wie zB JA sondern ist pausierbare Echtzeit.
Also alles in allem muss ich sagen: Für Fans des Genres mit Geduld und etwas dickerem Fell einen Blick wert.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6W-6DtgJSBI

author: {'steamid': '76561198011757986', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 72, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 72, 'last_played': 1480001910}
review:
Als begeisterter Fan des Klassikers Jagged Alliance 2 hat mich dieser titel zunächst sehr gereizt.
Jedoch ergaben sich bereits nach wenigen Minuten die ersten massiven Probleme, die ich hier einmal zusammenfassen will, um anderen Steamnutzern die Mängel dieses Titels aufzuzeige.
1.Der Spieleinstieg ist völlig unintuitiv, es gibt kaum Hilfestellung um neue Spieler mit den Funktionen vertraut zu machen. Lediglich durch viel erfahrung mit anderen Titel war es mir möglich die erste Stadt nach einiger Zeit zu verlassen.
2. Die Steuerung ist unpräzise, unintuitiv und wird durch die mäßige Grafik weiter erschwert.
3. Das Kampfsystem ist massiv zufällig und ebenfalls unübersichtlich/verwirrend. 
4. Die Spielwelt ist besonders in den (dank der verworrenen Kameraführung kaum einsehbaren) Innenbereichen lieblos und detailarm gehalten. 
5. Trotz moderner Hardware läuft das Spiel nicht sonderlich flüssig, Animationen wirken abgehackt.
6. Das Inventarmanagement ist eine Katastrophe und wird durch die fehlenden Erklärungen zu einem reinen "trial and error" Unterfangen.
7. Der Elefant im Raum ist die mangelnde Stabilität. Binnen weniger Minuten "Spielzeit" kam es (zumindest bei mir) zu mehreren Spielabstürzen, die sich auch durch änderung der Grafikeinstellung nicht beheben ließen. 

Fazit: Es ist schade, dass ein Spiel mit so viel Potential es schafft selbst im Vergleich zu deutlich älteren Titeln wie etwas Silent Storm so antik in Spielsteuerung und Ausstattung auszufallen 
2 / 10 Punkten

author: {'steamid': '76561198049688790', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 3343, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1066, 'last_played': 1664296998}
review:
Вот он, отличный повод проснуться с утра, придумать 7, 6, да хоть 2 причины променять унылый рабочий день на романтичные будни вольного стрелка. Достать из пыльного кейса любимый АК, Абакан, АЕК, G36, M4 (нужное подчеркнуть) и окунуться с головой в историю маленькой страны древних индейцев и бандитов с большой дороги. Тушить или разжигать пожар революции. Быть верным наймитом или плести интриги за спиной своих работодателей. Гоняться на чужбине за головами или редкими стволами, выбор только за вами. Никто вас здесь не осудит за мораль или её отсутствие, да и стоит ли судить человека, у которого магнум 357-го калибра заметно оттягивает кобуру.

Это все и вправду веские причины время от времени запускать эту старую, добрую игру и наслаждаться ей.

author: {'steamid': '76561198201769191', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 272, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 181, 'last_played': 1448755032}
review: Партийная рпг-стратегия с тактическими боями. Отсылка и духовный наследник серии Jagged Alliance. Предоставляет широкие возможности для обдуманного и тактически выверенного геймплея на больших территориях, проработанный арсенал и настраиваемая тактическая пауза способствуют наилучшему погружению в игровой процесс. Высокий порог вхождения и баги можно отнести к недостаткам, но прожженным игрокам это не помеха. Отличный пример оригинального игрового контента, рекомендую терпеливым к ознакомлению.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041949592', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 605, 'playtime_forever': 292, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 292, 'last_played': 1479398395}
review:
Hey everyone and this is my review about the game!


This is a RPGish/tactial strategy post-apocalypse game.


[h1]Interface/Menu/Settings[/h1]

 
[b]Video Settings information.[/b]

[list]
    [*] There are many resolution sizes available.
    [*] You can play the game fullscreen or windowed mode.
    [*] Able to toggle videos.
    [*] There are some tips available during the loading screen.
[/list]

[b]Volume Settings Information.[/b]

[list]
    [*] There is a music volume slidebar available.
    [*] There is a sound volume slidebar available.
    [*] There is a voice volume slidebar available.
    [*] There is an ambient volume slidebar available.
    [*]There is an interface volume slidebar available.
[/list]

[b]Miscellaneous Information.[/b]

[list]
    [*] You are able to change the camera speed and sensitivity.
    [*] There is a difficulty settings in the game.
[/list]


[h1]About the game.[/h1]

This is a really old game and im sure this would have been a huge success back then. You are able to pick your own character with their own attributes and advantages. You can also change their skills abit. You are dropped into the town. Searching for a guy. You are a soldier... but i can't call it a soldier, i have attacked a civillian with my bare hands and my character died from man-to-man fight.

[b]Ingame Information.[/b]

[list]
    [*] It has Attributes and skills.
    [*] You are able to skip video Cutscenes.
    [*] Really bad camera angles.
    [*] Sort of an open world.
    [*] Weak guidelines.
[/list]


[b]Miscellaneous Information.[/b]

[list]
    [*] None.
[/list]


[h1]Other things.[/h1]

Released in 2007!

No idea why, but when at the main menu or at options. The computer is really making weird noises. Ingame its fine.

-------------------

[quote] Reviews are always uploaded if i have at least played for 2 hours or more. Unless the game is really garbage and doesn't deserve the 2H limit.[/quote]

I Give this game a 2/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198329795660', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 167, 'playtime_forever': 556, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 556, 'last_played': 1478607688}
review: Well as a complete newcomer to the entire series, I found this game FAR more accessible than Brigade E5. The GFX, camera control and overall feel is still very difficult to get to grips with, yet this time I persisted for many hours, as the micro-management and combat system is very compelling. The game still seems far from amazing, and after my short time with game I still have no idea if I was 'playing it right'.. but I plan on returning to it at some stage..

author: {'steamid': '76561198277263860', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2968, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2968, 'last_played': 1477469967}
review:
Замечательная игра с уникальной тактической системой, вариативностью выбора стороны за которую вам сражаться.
Отличный арсенал оружия предоставленый в игре, который оставит только хорошее впечатление.
Но вес хорошо конечно не может быть.
Главные минусы этой игры это баги, которые приводят к вылету.
-вылетает игра просто так
-вылетает при попадании в голову главному персоонажу
-вылетает при попытке сохранится
-вылетает при попытке выйти в меню
-вылетает при попытке выйти на глобальную карту
конечно это не всегда но довольно припекает за прохождение игры
ну и небольшой минус что нет больших коробок с патронами как в бригаде Е5

В остальном все отлично, если не обращать внимания на баги то игра обязательна к ознакомлению любителям жанра.
А лучше в Hard life сразу играть....

author: {'steamid': '76561198026883887', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 8820, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5367, 'last_played': 1527132450}
review:
For those a fan of meticulous strategy, this game is for you. If you are a fan of RTS, you'll likely be bored. 7,62 plays at a slow pace. In my current 89 hours of gameplay, I've experienced a couple of firefights that sucked up two hours of time. Due to the player-controlled pausing system in which you can stop time to give directions to your mercinaries, an hour-long realtime firefight can be composed of only three or four minutes of action.

That's part of what makes this game great though. This system allows for complex and detailed micro-management of your squad of mercs in ways not achievable with other titles. Not to mention the attention to detail of the engine's weapons and ammo system. An incredibly diverse and large in-game arsenal compete with weapons attachments makes this game very enjoyable for the kit or gear-whore. Red-dot sight not cutting it for you? No problem, slap on an ACOG. Need a higher round count or faster reload time? Here's a 100-round Beta C-Mag and a roll of duct tape to tape two magazines together. Just to highlight how deep the game goes, most FPS or shooter-type games use an ammo-pool system where the ammo is reloaded from a pool of round. Detailed shooter games use a magazine by magazine system, where the ammo is counted by magazine (i.e. Red Orchestra). 7,62 uses a round-by-round system. The engine counts every individual bullet in the magazine. This leads to some interesting situations where you can top off your shotgun's tube or a partially filled rifle magazine with a different type or quality of ammo.

7,62 is not without its faults however. The game in its vanilla form is unplayable due to the glitches. You have to play this game with mods or you simply won't play at all. Fortunately, the Steam copy comes with the community patch and Blue Sun mod standard. Blue Sun is not without its glitches as well, but it does make the game playable while greatly expanding the arsenal and features as well as adding an entirely new questline seperate from the main questline. 

7,62 also suffers from a unique "memory drain/leak" issue that I'm not entirely sure how to explain. This presents an issue for lower-end machines that should have no issue running it. With low-end and mid-end machines more than a few years old, expect CTDs up the wazoo once you put some hours into the game. Unfortunately, there isn't a fix for this short of deleting all local content and reinstalling fresh and it can only get worse. Heed my warning, hard save frequently.

This is an enjoyable and realism-based title that I really wish was more polished. If you're a fan of detailed military strategy, for the couple bucks you'll pay for 7,62 High Calibre on a Steam sale its absolutely worth it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045218666', 'num_games_owned': 484, 'num_reviews': 59, 'playtime_forever': 7090, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 535, 'last_played': 1567958426}
review:
정확하게 딱10년전이맘때 어둠의루트로 구해서 했던게임이다.그때 재밌게했던향수덕분에(10년전에 버그로끝내엔딩을못봄;;;)이게임을 구입하게됐다.원래 brigade e5라는 게임의 후속작인데전작인 brigade e5를 해봤던유저라면 쉽게 적응할수있다.
장점은 뛰어난 물리엔진과 다양한퀘스트 돌발적으로 일어날수있는 각종이벤트와 미션이다.
이게임의 단점은 뭐니뭐니해도 버그다..그렇게 패치를 거듭했는데도 불구하고 게임중에 갑자기 윈도우 화면으로 빠져나간다거나 의도치않게 게임이 크리티컬에러로 접종돼버리는 희한한 상황이 이게임 하는 사람으로 하여금 혈압상승유발하게한다 ㅋㅋ
그리고 항상퀵세이브하라 그러면 위에 문제를 어느정도 극복하면서 재밌게할수있다.
그외엔 정말 개인적으론 이런게임의 궁극적인 시스템이라고 감히 단언할수있다.
JA팬이라면 광적으로 추천한다. 밀덕중에서도 총기관련 커스터마이징이나 전술전략에 신경쓰는 플레이어라면 한번쯤 해볼만하다고 말해줄수있겠다.

author: {'steamid': '76561198281518663', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 5542, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2086, 'last_played': 1660772955}
review:
Man, this game is so addicting that I forgot to play H&G and Warface for the last 3 or so days, however it does have a few problems

Pros:
+Addicting gameplay
+Loads of content
+Large weapon variety and balance
+multiple ways to play

Cons:
-Crashes randomly
-Crashes more often on Blue sun mod
-Configuration resets if you switch between mod and full game

I play on a Win 10 with Nvidia 980M, but for an old game I can brush it off

Oh, one more thing, *spoilers* theres a box under a camo tent that has a (atleast for me) A Berreta 92FS and a Benelli M4 Super 90 in it and when I try to take them the game just crashes, but I found out that the box just behind that one has the exact same thing

author: {'steamid': '76561198097621752', 'num_games_owned': 523, 'num_reviews': 142, 'playtime_forever': 277, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 150, 'last_played': 1498950711}
review:
[h1] This is probably the best game ever i have bought for few bucks![/h1] 

[h1] And now about the game.
Pros:[/h1] 
+Very hard or even Hardcore. (its very hard even on normal)
+Gun physics are great.
+Looting system is very good too.
+Wepon modifications.
+Other physics in the game are great too. (except what buildings can be destroyed)
+All your crew members are very important for you if they die, thats it, you lost them and there is no way to get them back.
+Health and injuries system, its very realistic, and you can easily bleed to death or get to bullet in your head or just a scrap from explosion what you or your enemy made and THATS IT you are DEAD!!!


[h1] Cons:[/h1] 
-No good toturial.
-It's way too hard at the beginning of the game.
-Bandits will keep attacking you and you will have to last stand against them for really long time until you get bigger squad size or better cars.
-Mercenaries (squad members) are way too expensive.
-Map isnt very big and only few towns.
-Few Combat Maps outside the towns, so you will keep fighting in zones again and again, but that isnt the main problem.

[spoiler] (played about 30hours in Hard Life DLC/MOD)[/spoiler]


[h1] My verdict about this game:[/h1] 
1) Stay away
2) Only recommended when on sale
[u]3) Recommended[/u]
4) Highly recommended
5) This is a must play

author: {'steamid': '76561198141397274', 'num_games_owned': 170, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 2213, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2167, 'last_played': 1446408956}
review:
This game is really good. I must say I was surprised that I was unaware for so long of such a good game. Note that I really like tactics based RPGs. 

Positives:

- A LOT of guns, seriously tons of different guns, different ammunition and even different mags,
- Innovative mechanics when your accuracy depends on your stress level
-  Challenging, On higher levels random encounters are really almost impossible
- Character development is well thought. You really see that levelling up makes sense
Negatives:
- Glitchy. Sometimes you will be shot through walls, sometimes granade explodes in a bit peculiar way,
- Music or maybe the lack of music (I think, there is music but it is boring and repetetive)
- Mechanics is not explained and given it's a Russian game (I think) sometimes its quite hard to get a good explanation what exactly this or that parameter does,
- Plot is only okeish: it's neither bad nor surprising 

Summary:
7-8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198112810429', 'num_games_owned': 2594, 'num_reviews': 578, 'playtime_forever': 8913, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8369, 'last_played': 1459501089}
review:
One of the three Apeiron games, famous with its game engine, made exactly for squad-based tactical wargames simulations. Recently it was updated with Hard Life community mod, which optimized some of the game's features and edged to maximum its strong and weak sides.

In short, I can suggest and propose that game only to quite a small cohort of true fans of tactical squad-based games a-la "Jagged Alliance". In fact, community-upgraded versions of 7.62 and Brigade E5, another Apeiron game, are probably the most capable successors and inheritors of Jagged Alliance good fortune (along with just a few more titles, like Silent Storm and some more).

So. You take the command over a small group of mercenaries, merged into another domestic war in the small 3rd-world country. You manage guns, tons of them, equip vests, scopes and other tacticool little things which make you a bit more ready-for-anything... And you constantly engaging in some fierce shootouts, where you need to use all your tactical skills and the best of luck, to stay alive for another day. Fight, collect trophies, rest, find a new quest for your squad, get to the new location, goto 10 - the golden formula from Jagged Alliance. If you're still reading, guess you already know all that drill.

Now, what's the special about the Apeiron engine and game in general?
First, it is NOT turn-based, it is using a smart-pause real-time pattern instead. You could have seen that in the recent "remake" Jagged Alliance: Back in Action, but trust me, it was only spoiled there. Apeiron created, up to the moment, the most complicated and advanced engine to perform a gunfight between small squads. Ballistics, lines of sights, variable reliefs and layouts, combat interferences, contusions - just name it - it is there. 

Second, if we don't speak about the engine, but overall game's features instead - sadly, it is weak, at best. Lame scenario, questionable and obscure quests and so on. If you're coming to the game, not just for refined tactical simulation, that's not the right project. I can suggest looking for the next Apeiron game, Marauder, as there will be at least some plot, narrative motivation and other things we're usually expecting from the complete game, as of any piece of art.

As of conclusion, 7.62 is a niche product, connoisseurs of the tactical combats only. The gameplay is about tuning your gear, shoot some folks, rinse and repeat. Guns-adorers would find much satisfaction there, with all charts, graphs for hundreds of various tools of death. Normal players, who are not ready to shift all those irons hours after hours and then perform one battle, about 2-3 minutes of "clear" time, in another dozen of hours, with every second micromanagement fixes, saves and reloads... Normal players will be either bored from the first look or drained and exhausted when with all the time needed to finish another Call-of-Duty project, they only (probably) manage to clear the first village there...

As of my mark, usually, I'm not high about projects where so many gameplay parts are obviously ill-performed. But, with 7.62, with all community support... It is worth my 8/10 mark, as I'm really like squad-based tactics and guns, and this is one the best on given patterns.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067095800', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 19, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 16, 'last_played': 1489512547}
review: Несколько лет уже знаю об этой игре, периодически перепрохожу - игра интересна, многогранна, увлекательна. Очень доволен, что практически бесплатно, с громадной скидкой, получил оригинал, да ещё сразу мод Hard life прилагается. Эту игру назвали лучшим тактическим симулятором боя малых групп. В общем, рекомендую. Только хочу заметить, что технически игра сделана не самым лучшим образом, случаются утечки памяти, краши и так далее. И от себя скажу, что немного помогает запускать её напрямую, при незапущенном клиенте steam, который достал уже впустую теребонькать файлы игры.

author: {'steamid': '76561198059797950', 'num_games_owned': 327, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 2359, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1857, 'last_played': 1578447135}
review:
Ein sehr gutes Squad Taktik Spiel. 

Führe dein Söldnersquad durch ein schönes mittelamerikanisches Setting das mich an den War of Drugs errinert.
Welcher weniger schön ist. 

Du kannst das Spiel pausieren, den Söldnern Befehle geben und deine Pläne dann beim entfalten zusehen.

High Calibre gibt dir alle Optionen, unzählige Waffen und Features. 
Eins meiner Lieblingsmomente ist, dem Gegner eine nicht scharfe Handgranate zuzuwerfen, um ihn in die Flucht zu treiben und die Granate später wieder einzusacken. Praktisch!


Alles in allem ist es ein schöner geistiger Nachfolger von Jagged Alliance 2. 

Das einzige HC zurückhält ist das scheinbar mangelde Budget. 
Dieses manifestiert sich in kaum vorhandener Sprachausgabe und in seiner verbugtheit. 
Die Grafik ist auch alles anders als flashy.

Daher bin ich auch erstaunt, dass die vielen Waffen so detailreich und liebevoll modelliert sind.

[b]Unbedingte Kaufempfehlung wenn du gerne Söldnertrupps in einem mittelamerikanischem Setting managest![/b]

Der Entwickler hat auch über das Beta Tab in den Eigenschaften
die Mods Mercopalypse und die Community Patches nachgeliefert! 
Klasse!

author: {'steamid': '76561198019407353', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 58, 'playtime_forever': 1120, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 108, 'last_played': 1533957248}
review:
Для начала : игра не так страшна и сложна, как может показаться !
Да интерфейс настолько огромен, что про него можно писать книги, да курсор часто чудит, да тяжело быстро переключиться на нужный этаж внутри помешений, но держите большой палец 
на пробеле и почаще включай паузу и не торопитесь, эта игра - не про это. Рекомендую всем любителям тактических экшенов и тем кому понравились Just Cause и Xenus: Boiling point, к слову, золотое издание последней просто бомба. Шевелите мозгами, ведите себя прилично, грамотно выбирайте арсенал, обыскивайте : ящики, коробки, машины... в них можно найти много полезного. Да и самое главное, если есть возможность поговорить с врагом, советую это сделать.

author: {'steamid': '76561198063472440', 'num_games_owned': 224, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 5, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5, 'last_played': 1439412335}
review:
Итак это игра для тех кто играя в Jagged Alliance - Back in Action почувствовал что его обманули и вместо джаги подсунули очередной "блокбастер".

Если вы желаете погружения в атмосферу банановой республики во главе с диктатором и полным п...цом в стране, то эта игра для вас.

Но для тех кто желает углубить и расширить её возможности - используйте модификацию 7.62 HardLife.

Я много играл в нелицензионную копию игры и купил её наконец в стиме из уважения к её создателям, а так же к тем кто делает мод Hard Life addon.

Игра сложна для освоения и первое время вам будет очень тяжело. Как только вы поймете для чего так много кнопочек в интерфейсе - вы начнете ловить от неё кайф. 

Противник в ней не болванчики, которые просто бегут на вас и умирают. Вы будете подавлять противника обстреливая его и тем вамым повышая у него уровень адреналина, в результате он будет в панике стрелять быстро, но не точно. И в этот момент к нему подводите своего бойца с ножом. :-)

Или, например, одев ПНВ на бойца вы заметите, что иконка стрельбы через оптический прицел затенена и не активна - это значит что с одетым ПНВ боец не может использовать оптику. Но войдя в его инвентарь и сделав на ПНВ действие поднять - вы сможете использовать оптический прицел и при необходимости обратно возвращать ПНВ, не снимая оптики - стрелять через мушку и целик (не на всех пушках возможно, но на СВД можно).

А уж самодельные гранаты, растяжки, мины, взрывчатка, самодельные выстрелы из миноментых мин для РПГ и прочие вещи очень интересно разнообразят игру ибо коеч-то из этого можно собрать самому "на кленке". :-)

author: {'steamid': '76561198125661020', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 552, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 472, 'last_played': 1453439806}
review: Have you ever been playing arma and say to yourself what is it was turn based. well now that dream is here in this game. I like this game alot. It has all the guns i love and they seem like there real counter parts, theres lots of different gear and vehicles as well. the missions are interesting with some very funny and dark writing, each mission you usally have to make desicions on how to do it menaing you cna just kill everyone use diplomacy or take bribes or just be a scumbag what ever floats your boat. It also comes with a community mod which add a huge amount of content as well as graphic upgrades and i can play the game on my widescreen which is nice. if you like turn based and you like mil-sims heres your game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197991529824', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 4975, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 625, 'last_played': 1473982463}
review:
762 High Calibre is a top-down RTS game with RPG elements. You play as a mercenary hired to find and assassinate a man hiding somewhere in the war-torn region of Algiera, where a corrupt government faces off against an equally corrupt organization of rebels. Bandits, smugglers, mercenaries, and drug cartels run amok-taking advantage of the civil war to turn a profit at the expense of innocent people. You will have to choose your battles wisely and your friends carefully.

The gameplay is good, with a focus on a large amount of weapon variation and the ability for players to choose how they want to apporach a given tactical scenario or situation. Either way, the player will almost always be vastly outnumbered by enemies, and combat is brutal (though in a good, challenging way.) and rarely felt frustrating to me personally. The player is given the option of choosing which side to support (The government or the rebels), which of course affects the story.

The game does have a number of issues-there are some translation problems here and there or stilted dialogue, and the camera is uncooperative, especially when trying to rotate when you are near the edge of a map. There are some very occasional crashes.

All of these things, however, are certainly worth dealing with, at least for me personally.

The game comes with the hard life addon, which adds a significant amount of content to the game, though personally, I would recommend the blue sun mod, which also comes standard with every purchase (and can be activated by going to your properties-->betas tab, and clicking "Community_patch_and_bsm" from the dropdown menu. It has much of the content from te hard life addon, plus much more.)

All in all, I'd say this game was an enjoyable experience for me.

review:
well lets begin il say now sry if my eng is a bit bad.About the game this game is great but dont take it like that tho this game is full of bugs yes but if you get over this bugs this is one of very little games that do this genere this well but again i am not playing the vanila version i am playing with blue sun mode and Mercapocalypse this mods add so much content its insane 

But now lets talk about some of the bugs i got and you may get to again i never played vanila from the start i played with blue sun mode later merca mode too

ok 1 bug i get alot is AI shooting trough walls rocks anything that you cant shoot trough the AI is somehow able to another one is AI clipping trought this object's and getting faster to u another bug i used to get and still sometimes i get it is in some maps its random when my soldiers walk over certain area they go under ground you can only see thier body and head legs are under ground stuff like that is pretty rare for me but might not be for you another one i really hate is freez's just random freez's that last around 15s they always happen in the start of the game or reloading a save yes makes sense maybe game takes time to load all of the content but still its bit annoying there are some other bugs but you get the point.


Now for the great things this game does  again talking about moded 


the combat system in this game is just amazing the depth you get makes it so fun a thing that i love the most is the weapon amout there are over hunderd of weapons of course most are modded weapons but thats why i play it with mods  
and the mods are free so you can too there are alot of mercs to recruit too yes you are limited to 6 ppl but if someone dies and well you are playing like never reloading for death so he stays dead u got alot of ppl to replace him all got thier skills and cons all can level up too the story in this game is almost none existent its very basic never payed attantion to it.the game runs in a turn base system but not fully there arent really turns but actions that take time real time like to shoot you need 3s to aim and 1s to shoot so 4s total after that if no other merc is doing an action it pauses the game squad control can get annoying if you got 6 its hard sometimes and they love to bump into each other so that makes it even harder but its still fun there are alot of other great things but il let you find them by your self i hope this was helpful for you guys :D.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009078453', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 238, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 238, 'last_played': 1422654010}
review:
7,62 High Calibre tries to mix the genres of tactical top view shooter and RPG.
Keyword being "tries" here. Because it fails. It's not all bad but definitely a bad game:

PROS
* Character equipment customization
* Wandering around the streets gathering intel on objectives, playing in a undercover operative kind of way
* Active pause to give orders and evaluate situations before moving

CONS
* Terribly confusing. Knowing what to do, where to go or even what your objective is or why you're even here is a challenge in itself
* Terrible AI that makes the enemies either dumb as hell or incredibly overpowered
* Luck based combat: Sometimes a character can tank a few bullet like it's nothing more than mosquito bites, sometimes a single bullet will knock them down and they will take forever to get back up, while still being shot at (so it pretty much means death). This applies for the payer or the enemies.
* Automatic actions are terrible: the game autopauses when you're spotted by an enemy but you want to pause because pause too because you saw the enemy coming? Odds are you're just going to unpause the autopause that paused teh game a few miliseconds before you pressed the button. Happens ALL THE TIME. Too bad, considering combats are so clunky that even easy encounters can go to hell very fast.
* The interface is unclear
* It takes forever to move around or to do something, even organizing the inventory is tedious

TL;DR: This can could be good if it wasn't for it's slowness, the confusing interface, story, missions and terrible attempts at automatising things. It's really one hell of a clunky mess that drags down the few good points that made me buy the game

39/100

author: {'steamid': '76561198166888996', 'num_games_owned': 139, 'num_reviews': 65, 'playtime_forever': 7430, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5503, 'last_played': 1701299005}
review:
Это полезная игра, в которой не важен скилл, а знания, если вы увлекаетесь оружием, то можете купить его здесь и узнать о нём всё (от даты производства, до уровня перегрева и диаграммы отдачи). Хотите повыпендриваться перед друзьями своими познаниями об оружии, то эта игра для вас.

Конкретно о игре:
Она не допилена, это факт. Разработчики слишком сильно опередели время, добавив в такой слабый движок баллистику, физический дым, воздействие теней и звуков на скрытность персонажа, а так же такие факторы как ветер и зрение персонажа. Мы даже после взрыва осколочной гранаты  реально сможем увидеть КАЖДЫЙ осколок, и место, куда он полетит, а взрывная волна... так вообще край. Из-за данной "сверхнавороченной'' по физике игры она и вылетает, но именно такие игры учат главному в деятельности геймера - СОХРАНЯЙТЕСЬ ПОЧАЩЕ!

author: {'steamid': '76561198008429783', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 5315, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4791, 'last_played': 1468669365}
review:
Obscure, Buggy, quirky, funky UI, no tutorial, steep learning curve...but, wow, I havent had this much fun since discovering mount and blade : warband....similar game but in a modern setting...open world....picked up this game on a whim for $5...best $5 I have spent in a long time....a mix of an RPG adventure game, tactical battle sim and sandbox strategy game....micro manage your battles down to the 1/100th of second....fiddle with your equipment and loadout to your hearts desire...make sure you start with the Blue Sun Mod and Merc 1.2 mod installed...watch some Ninja2dan's Lets Play Vids....read some of the walkthrus posted and you will be good to go....takes some time to learn the game....virtually no instructions or help available except for the few diehards posting here....

Pros:

·       Perfect Combination of RPG/Sandbox/Tactical Battle Sim/Squad Building & Progression

             o   RPG: Loose yourself in a Fictional Modern S. America setting. Character & squad stat progression, interesting text based quest/story line missions.

             o   Sandbox: Establish a base of operations whereby you can send out militia to take control of towns, freedom of action to do quests, raids, random encounters, etc.. Light strategy and economy, options. Maybe you are cut out to be your own faction leader and establish regional control over the nearby towns and villages...

              o   Tactical Battle Sim: This is the meat of the game. Engage in a thrilling firefight with various factions. Stop and go, pauseable RTS action that is a good compromise between real time and turn based tactical management. The detail is absolutely amazing: Reaction times, visibility, ammo, burst rates, mobility, positioning, line of sight and field of fire, aim/fire options, morale, wound care, weapons, weapons and more weapons. Save often, because you will be replaying game saves when you die…

           o   Squad Building: Manage your team, equipment, progression, etc..

·       Detailed: Everything is represented: 100’s of weapons, combat, tactics, actions, ammunition types, loads of variety.

·       Immersive

·       A great many options and a variety of things to do

·       Compelling, addictive game play…hard to put down.

·       Semi destructible environment. Watch things explode or accumulate damage.

 

Cons:

o   Frequent crashes and game freezes. Save often. Some have found this a deal killer, but once you come to expect it, I don’t think it a huge issue…minor annoyance.

o   Unintuitive gameplay. The game is not polished and the quests are a bit buggy or finicky. You may have to do watch Ninja2dan’s youtube videos or read Ssanders walkthru’s to get an idea how to play.

o   Obscure company and game: Translation from Russian to English is rough. The base game is somewhat broken. Adding the fanbased Blue Sun Mod and Mercpocalypse 1.2 add ons are a must.

o   Dated Graphics.

o   Camera is clunky. You have to work around some camera angles. Manageable but annoying.

 
Update: I now have over 50 hours in this game...loving it....I dont know how i missed this game when it first came out...perfect blend of an RPG Sandbox and a Tactical Battle Sim....the detail is amazing....

Advice to folks who want to get started:
Watch Ninja2dan's 2nd and 14th 7.62 video in his series on youtube.
Read over ssander's chapter 6 pdf walkthru on Bennie and Clive. Look for link under the thread about walkthur's.
***Ninja2dan's 2nd video and the walkthru on Bennie and Clive will get you Paquito and Bennie as free team members.

review:
If you are looking for approachability or good writing this game isn't for you. This game is the opposite of those things. The writing is bad and the tutorial is a pdf explaining all the interface buttons. The gameplay however, is amazing. It's been a long time since i've been as addicted to a game as I am to this one. 
(Just make sure you save often, as this game crashes 95% of the time)

author: {'steamid': '76561198034916917', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 16461, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 499, 'last_played': 1576596976}
review: Really fun game. Storyline is interesting as well. Completely open world, combat is in any way you wish. My favorite moment is assaulting a base by running into a shed, grenading and shooting through the doorway and killing 10 guys, then running to a tower and sniping the rest. But the tower is made of wood that bullets breeze through so I got really shot up. I had to slip out and sneak around to knife the last two snipers. The AI is great. They actually throw the grenades back at you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028450654', 'num_games_owned': 5809, 'num_reviews': 161, 'playtime_forever': 133, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 133, 'last_played': 1430557124}
review:
Leider muss ich 7,62 High Calibre negativ bewerten ich fand es in der Vorgeschichte eigentlich okay und das Alter stört mich bei Spielen ja auch nicht wirklich allerdings gibt es in 7,62 High Calibre extrem viele Bugs, die das Spiel einfach nur nervig machen.

Es ist nicht einmal so, dass man ein paar Stunden spielen könnte bis man einen der vielen Bugs begegnet, nein, das passiert schon relativ am Anfang. Erst ist es diverse Male abgestürzt und als ich dann wirklich mal eine Stunde am Stück spielen konnte hatte clipping Fehler, meine Figur hing in einem Haus fest, konnte von seiner Position in der Wand munter Menschen abballern und ich wurde auch von denen nicht gesehen. Klingt im ersten Moment witzig, allerdings darf man dann die Mission neu starten und alles wieder erspielen. Das ist total nervig und daher mache ich es dieses Mal kurz: Kauft euch dieses Spiel nicht, ihr werdet euch höchstwahrscheinlich nur ärgern. 

[url=mediennerd.de/neu-auf-steam/]Es gibt aber auch Spiele, die mir gefallen[/url]

review: You are a mercenary sent to a war-torn Banana republic to bring back an idiot who double-crossed the Russian mob. Along the way, you'll accept jobs from grieving family, the rebels, the government, MI6 agents, anyone who'll give you the time of day. The action is a sort of RTS/RPG thing. You have your squad of 1-6 hardened warriors, and you choose their equipment, stance, location, etc. A single bullet can send everything to hell, so you have to be extremely careful and stratrgic. Or you can just quick-save and quick-load like I do.

author: {'steamid': '76561198038060935', 'num_games_owned': 791, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 5786, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5455, 'last_played': 1585881615}
review:
A VERY rough diamond here. There are a bunch of great ideas in this game, massive amounts of weapons and equipment and great ballistics simulation.
Many bugs, however, and unfinished features hold this title back quite a bit.
Thankfully the mods (provided here on steam) make it considerably better and also expand on the content, by adding a whole new quest line (some additional 6-10hours of content!) and even more guns!
If you enjoy meticulous tactics, and are at least somewhat aroused by firearms, this game should suit you quite fine!

author: {'steamid': '76561198047776241', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 5254, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4898, 'last_played': 1488304939}
review:
you can divide my time in this game as so:

30% playing the game -- acting out quests, shooting the bad guys, trekking the maps, etc.
30% selecting what guns to use -- there are so many freakin guns. i spend an equal amount of time looting and reorganizing as i do killing folk.
15% reloading saves because i did not like the outcome of the particular firefight, you can't always do good but you can always do better.
10% searching the interweb for help on quests, usually only finding it in russian or polish forums. only very common problems are solved in english. but google translate is cool.
5% "i wonder what happens if i......."
5% dealing with bugs
5% learning russian from my companions

+++++++++++++++
Fun, Challenging, Satisfying, Funny (maybe I'm sick...)
------------------------
Occasional bugs, Low-Quality production, the controls oh my goodness the controls...

7,62 High Calibre requires patience, focus, liquor, tactics, patience, patience, liquor, tactics.
Personally, I found it fun. The story is lackluster, the characters are a joke, there are however some funny dialogues.
I believe it's called the Blue Sun mod, improves the game but i personally have not installed it.

The game is far better than the trailer makes it out to be.

I'm only reccommending it for a certain type of people -- the people who bothered to stumble upon the game anyways.

author: {'steamid': '76561198055879714', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 11729, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3857, 'last_played': 1701564108}
review:
7.62 High Calibre is a Strategy Game developed by Apeiron and is the sequel to the game Brigade E5. It almost feels like a spirtual successor to the old Jagged Alliance games, which have influenced many games in their time. This game does not fail to impress, and emulate all the key elements of Jagged Alliance which made it such a good series, while bringing new features to the table.

Based in the fictional nation of Algeira, a country just north of Brigade E5's previous warzone, you are a mercenary who has been hired to hunt down a Russian man who screwed over a bank and was never apprehended. He has fled to Algeira to avoid prosecution, and you'll have to hunt him down by any means necessary, and bring him back dead or alive. Of course, you'll start the game with rather shitty equipment which means you have to spend some time doing jobs on the side, but that's one of the big advantages of the game in a way, as it is a strategy game, yet you get to carve out your own destiny and plan prior to getting stuck in and finishing the main quest before you've even done the cool parts. If you go try to go ahead with the main plot and speedrun it, you'll most likely get curb-stomped unless you know what you're doing, but you're always free to roam the jungle and cities of Algeira, finding quests and new mercs to hire on your way, up to a 6-man squad.

A big plus in my opinion is the HUGE variety of weapons you can get. Literally tons, from Glock 22's and P220's to Remington 870 Magnums and AKS-74U's, all the way up to FN Minimi's and M14 SOCOM rifles. You'll never go more than an hour without finding at least a few new weapons to play with, and they all come in many flavours of calibre, allowing you to mix and match your ammo with Armour Piercing Rounds, FMJ Rounds, and many more variants. Many weapons can also be custom rigged with scopes and lasers to allow you to get the most out of them in a firefight too. Even better is that the game can be installed with the Blue Sun Mod which adds a massive amount of content & weapons to a game which already has plenty to play with. I will mention how to install this mod at the end!

The game's key feature is Real-Time Pausing, which allows for a mix between turn-based and real-time gameplay, allowing you to experience the best of both worlds. The game can be paused at any time to allow you to command your merry band of mercenaries, and then unpaused to let them carry out their actions. Alternatively you don't need to pause the game once (The game does it automatically VERY often but it can easily be disabled), and instead command your team on the fly, allowing for fast-paced combat and tactical planning to overcome the enemy. 

Sound Effects - 7.62 has a lot of good sound effects, mostly for the weapons you can get your hands on. Turn bass up on your computer and expect to hear some ear-shattering explosions and gunshots loud enough to kill a blue whale.

Graphics - The game is a little dated now, and the graphics aren't really up to competition with the likes of XCOM - Enemy Unknown, but it's still a beautiful game. Watching the sun set over Algeira as you mow down squads of bandits with unending bullets is truly a wonderous sight. Some of the textures of the game aren't the greatest, but again, it's not a new game. 

AI - The AI is what makes the game so challenging. They're bloody smart, and will routinely change tactics just to get the drop on you. Snipers on your squad can be expected to be flanked while they shoot at other bad guys, and you'll have grenades thrown at you purely to force you to retreat, giving the enemy more ground to corner you into. They'll even retreat themselves if they know they're in trouble, and will regroup with their buddies so they can have another pop at you. If it seems too difficult however, you do have an option to dumb down the AI so they aren't performing counter-attacks that would see Delta Force hang their heads in shame.

Playability - The game is very playable and enjoyable, albeit being a bit confusing at first. Tossed into some Latin country with nothing but a TT-33 and ammo can obviously be a little uninformative, so you'll have to do most of the snooping around yourself. The controls are relatively simple, but do get a little getting used to. One of the good (or bad, depending how you know guns) things about the game is that guns must be cleaned, have their magazines filled individually, and then loaded into the firearm that uses them, as it obviously doesn't help trying to fire empty mags at someone trying to take your head off. So bear in mind to use a firearm effectively -

1. Make sure you have the right mags for the gun.
2. Make sure you have the right calibre of ammunition for the gun.
3. Make sure you have the gun loaded with a mag of ammo.

It may seem a little condescending, but it's painfully easy to run into battle and forget that you never loaded your mags up, leaving you one full magazine to fight many enemies, unless you want to waste ages loading up each mag as you get shot at. 

~The game also gives you a lot of leeway too, you aren't in a rush to complete the main quest, and you never really have to. If you just want to shoot cops in a 3rd World Dictatorship then the game won't stop you. But the Army might. On the other hand, if you want to hire your own private army and run a revolution of your own, then you can quite easily do that.
~The developers of the game are very supportive and helpful to their community, who you can find on the discussions of this game frequently assisting players with technical issues and other options. They are very polite and can definitely be relied on, which is always a good thing.

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

The bad things worth mentioning 

~ The game does have a tendency to crash. Make sure you save often and keep more than one save. The game auto-saves quite often, but even losing one save can set you back a little.
~Sometimes enemies will get stuck on ladders for whatever reason, so if you've killed all the enemies you see but are still technically in 'combat mode', check the ladders.
~Whether this is good or bad depends on how you like your game, (I like this but not everyone might) but the game is ridiculously difficult. You can add as many modifiers to make the game as easy as possible as you wish, but even then, enemies are very accurate and can shoot you in the head, (Near blinding you) shooting you in the chest (Crippling you), leg shots and even arm shots which will send your current weapon flying on the floor, stunning you in the process. Sometimes you'll end up in shock if you encounter many enemies at once, get shot at, or whatever else. It can be frustrating, but the enemy is also prone to all of this, so make your shots count. (The game is rather punishing but very satisfying to play)
~The game is rather cheesy and I wouldn't blame you for forgetting you aren't fighting in the Congo in the 80's, especially with some of the silly dialogue options. The only thing that convinced me otherwise was the fact you can find things like Kriss Super V's and XM8's if you're lucky.
~Like most RPG's, you can screw some missions up, and not even realise until you get to them. What I mean is that last guy you blasted in that town? Oh yeah, he's part of a quest later. So try not to be too trigger happy, even if it is just so you can kill them and take their weapons.

[All in all however, this game is definitely worth buying. It's a steal too, for only $5, or £4. The Blue Sun Mod is recommended, as it adds a lot to this great game, as well as having patches. You can install it by right clicking on the game, going to propeties, beta (I think it's the last tab) and clicking the community patch.] One of my personal favourites, and I hope it'll be one of yours too. 9/10.

review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198027083607', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1732, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 826, 'last_played': 1506885834}
review:
(This refers to BlueSunMod)

Excellent RT alternative to JA2 1.13. As mentioned by other reviewers, all the limitatons and problems are due to the engine and unfortunately will never change. The most realistic and detailed squad based real time strategy you can play currently. (I wish JA2 modders could do the same and offer all their builds on steam)

I believe that all the contributing mod creaters (R@S first and foremost( should be given a percentage of the sales, if not only of the sales that use the mod. (which is easily trackable) 

The only thing I would wish for is a way to watch the replays of the battles, it would be fun to see that huge battle you spent 6 hours on to be completed in 5 minutes in real time. 

As an advice to those that are gonna play BSM for the first time, I suggest to skip the boot camp, since it will get very frustrating very quickly and takes a lot of time. Actually it is itself a complete DLC of sorts.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043546565', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 96, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 96, 'last_played': 1425895018}
review: I would have liked to fully enjoy this game but I can't even get past the first battle. If any enemy notices me or goes to shoot at me or in some case I go to shoot at an enemy the game instantly crashes to windows. No error report no warning not even a crash log so that I could figure out how to fix the crashing. All in all the camera is annoying but the concept of this seems fun. The sheer amount of controls at your disposal are overwhelming but it fits nicely. So in otherwords the only reason I wont recommend this game is that I didnt even get to fully enjoy it much less play the first battle.
